intro: Eutrema salsugineum, commonly known as sea rocket, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils. The plant has alternate, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that are arranged in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in siliques, which are characteristic of the mustard family. Eutrema salsugineum is notable for its ability to tolerate high salinity and is often found in maritime environments.
